physical_appearance:This is a watercolour painting of the artist\u0027s memory of the Batu Gajah Prison. It features a three-storey building in the background. There is a raised Japanese flag in the middle. On the foreground
 there are several roofed structures on the grounds of the prison. There is a row of drawn arrows from a third-floor window to the bottom of the prison grounds. There is a written caption below the painting. The painting is signed and dated at the bottom-left.

sgcool_label_text:This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n\r\nThis drawing is painted from the memory of Tan Chong Tee and depicts the plan of the Batu Gajah prison where he and Lim Bo Seng were imprisoned from 1944 to 1945.

metadata.title_text: Plan of the Batu Gajah Prison ?????
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a watercolour painting of the artist's memory of the Batu Gajah Prison. It features a three-storey building in the background. There is a raised Japanese flag in the middle. On the foreground, there are several roofed structures on the grounds of the prison. There is a row of drawn arrows from a third-floor window to the bottom of the prison grounds. There is a written caption below the painting. The painting is signed and dated at the bottom-left.

metadata.subject_terms_3: Watercolour painting Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

This drawing is painted from the memory of Tan Chong Tee and depicts the plan of the Batu Gajah prison where he and Lim Bo Seng were imprisoned from 1944 to 1945.
